results.title: Little Flower = Xiao Hua [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Zhang Zheng and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description: Set in 1930, this melodrama focuses on the fate of two sisters who are separated as babies and grow up in different families unaware of each other’s existence. They are reunited by chance as young adults after they join the People’s Liberation Army where they also discover their long lost brother. Cast includes Joan Chen, Liu Xiaoquing, Cheng Chong and Guoqiang Tang. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Little Burgundy = La P'tite Bourgogne
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein, Maurice Bulbulian, George C. Stoney, Robert Forget and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: When an old area of a city is to be demolished to make way for a new low-rental housing development, is there anything that the residents can do to protect their own interests? This film, produced in 1968, airs such a situation in the Little Burgundy district of Montreal. It shows how citizens organized themselves into a committee that made effective representations to City Hall and influenced the housing policy.

results.title: Little Britain. The Complete first series
results.creator_credit: Steve Bendelack, Myfanwy Moore and BBC
results.brief_description: Little Britain as seen on ABC television is a surreal comedy featuring lunatics, misfits, teenage delinquents and bad transvestites. The BAFTA award winning series was written and performed by Matt Lucas and David Williams who’s range of the grotesque and, at the same time, everyday characters are set to surprise. Funny and perverse. Narrated by Tom Baker.

results.title: Little big top
results.creator_credit: Bill Brind, Colin Low, Michael McKennirey, Tony Ianzelo, Torben Schioler and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Provides an insight into the magic generated by the Royal Brothers’ Circus, a tent circus of a type that is fast disappearing. Torrential rains, axles sunk in mud, shaky performances, and a monumental tent that must be pulled up and down once a day do not inhibit the fifteen trucks and assorted beasts from travelling around at a rate of one town a day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Brind, Colin Low, Michael McKennirey, Tony Ianzelo, Torben Schioler and ONF | NFB

results.title: Little Bear: hide and seek
results.creator_credit: Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Raymond Jafelice, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Nelvana
results.brief_description: This video contains six delightful adventures of Little Bear, the furry fellow based upon the series of books written by Else Homelund Minarik and illustrated by Maurice Sendak. These animated works with their gentle rhythm and family values will delight the very young as Little Bear and his family and friends go about daily life in the forest. The programs are: “What will Little Bear wear?” Mother Bear teaches Little Bear that the best coat to keep him warm in winter is his own fur. “Hide and seek” a universal game played and enjoyed by Little Bear and his friends Cat, Hen, Duck and Owl. “Little Bear goes to the moon” Little Bear’s imagination takes off as he creates a special moon hat. “Birthday soup” to celebrate his birthday, Little Bear invites the gang over to share in some imaginary soup. “Polar Bear” Little Bear’s fur becomes a different colour after a painting mishap. “Gone Fishing” Little Bear goes fishing but takes his imagination with him.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Raymond Jafelice, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Nelvana

results.title: Litter
results.brief_description: A film designed to alert children to the problems of littering. A koala puppet shows children in the audience of a puppet show, several examples of public places spoiled and contaminated by litterbugs. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Literature application: stories
results.brief_description: A literature teacher shows a student who runs a marionette theatre how to appreciate a good story: by studying its plot, characters and setting.

results.title: Literacy for a lifetime
results.creator_credit: Paul Hawker, Ben Cardillo and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In today’s society, the ability to communicate effectively is vital, and people communicate with each other in many ways. Joan Rothery shows how to apply the principles of written communication and their effect on written literacy in the primary school. Teacher’s notes prepared by Jim Martin and Joan Rothery.

results.title: Literacy and common sense: a year 6 student encounter with print
results.creator_credit: Rick Cavaggion and Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.)
results.brief_description: Don Holdaway, noted literacy development educator, gives a lesson in which the children anticipate the words and line endings in a poem. In conversation with Ralph Fairbrother, he relates this to recent research into reading and a “reading for meaning” approach.

results.title: Listening: a key to problem solving
results.creator_credit: Donald R. Ham, A. Scott Miller, Robert Boucher and Paramount Communications
results.brief_description: A dramatised view of how well listening occurs in an office situation. An employee is promoted despite his verbal and non verbal objections, and problems arise. Solutions to the problem are explored as the film points out listening techniques which will reduce problems and improve working relationships.
